p: Results: A total of 192 patients were screened with 51 (27 %) patients admitted with a mental health disorder (15 patients as a direct consequence and 36 patients with an existing mental health problem). The patients with a mental health disorder were significantly younger than the controls (p < 0.05) however there was no difference in APACHE II scores. There were no significant differences in mortality, mechanical ventilation days or ICU length of stay between the two groups. There was a significant difference in the mortality rate between the patients admitted as a direct consequence of a mental health disorder and the control group (p < 0.05)
